SEARCH
Package gl.controller

Class GLController

java.lang.Object
gl.controller.GLController
public class GLController extends Object
The GLController class is responsible for handling user interactions and controlling the Game of Life application.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GLController(GLModel model, GLView view, ResourceBundle bundle, GLFooter footerV)
    Constructs a GLController with the specified model, view, and resource bundle.

  • Constructor Details

    • GLController

      public GLController(GLModel model, GLView view, ResourceBundle bundle, GLFooter footerV)
      Constructs a GLController with the specified model, view, and resource bundle.
      Parameters:
      model - The GLModel instance to control.
      view - The GLView instance to update with game changes.
      bundle - The ResourceBundle for localization.
      footerV - The GLFooter instance to update with game changes.

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame(String steps)
      Starts the game with the specified number of steps or infinitely if steps is empty.
      Parameters:
      steps - The number of steps to run the game, or an empty string for infinite mode.

    • stopGame

      public void stopGame()
      Stops the game.

    • fillRandomly

      public void fillRandomly()
      Fills the game board with random cell states.

    • nextStep

      public void nextStep()
      Advances the game by one step.

    • prevStep

      public void prevStep()
      Reverts the game by one step.

    • restartGame

      public void restartGame()
      Restarts the game by stopping it and clearing the board.

    • checkInput

      public String checkInput(String newValue)
      Validates and sets the new rule input for the game.
      Parameters:
      newValue - The new rule input string.
      Returns:
      An error message if the input is invalid, otherwise null.

    • toggleManualMode

      public void toggleManualMode()
      Toggles between manual and automatic game modes.

    • setCellState

      public void setCellState(int x, int y)
      Sets the state of the cell at the specified coordinates when in manual mode.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the cell.
      y - The y-coordinate of the cell.

    • handleSolution

      public void handleSolution()
      Handles the execution of a user-specified number of steps in the game. Shows a dialog for the user to input the number of steps, then executes the specified number of steps in the game. If no input is provided, it executes 100 steps.

    • changeLanguage

      public void changeLanguage(ResourceBundle newBundle)
      Changes the language resource bundle for the controller.
      Parameters:
      newBundle - The new language resource bundle.

    • handleCellClick

      public void handleCellClick(int x, int y)
      Handles the click event on a cell in the game board.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the clicked cell.
      y - The y-coordinate of the clicked cell.
